com.jgaap.backend
Class CSVIO

java.lang.Object
  com.jgaap.backend.CSVIO

public class CSVIO
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the prettiest in all of jgaap. This class handles the parsing and creation of CSV files.

Author:
Michael Ryan

altWriteCSV

public static void altWriteCSV(java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> informationMatrix,
                               java.lang.String fileName)
This method creates and writes to a csv file and releases the Vectors back to memory.

Parameters:
informationMatrix - contains the information you want in each cell and where you want the cells
fileName - name of the csv file that will be created

printCSV

public static void printCSV(java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> csvMatrix)
This method prints the the current matrix to the terminal in a similar way to how it will appear in the csv. This is for testing purposes.

Parameters:
csvMatrix - contains the information you want in each cell and where you want the cells

readCSV

public static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> readCSV(java.io.File file)
parses a csv document and places it in a representation of columns and rows using vectors

Parameters:
file - the csv file
Returns:
a vector of vectors of strings this gives a representation of infromation in string within the vectors

                            java.io.File file)
writes to the csv without releasing the Vector to memory

Parameters:
csvMatrix - contains the information you want in each cell and where you want the cells
file - the csv file you want to create

writeCSV

                            java.lang.String fileName)
Creates and writes to a file in the csv format

Parameters:
csvMatrix - information to be writen to file
fileName - name of the file to be creatd and writen
